intro: Daboecia cantabrica var. rosea, commonly known as the pink heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Spain and southern France. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white, depending on the variety. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and coastal scrub habitats. Daboecia cantabrica var. rosea is adapted to harsh maritime climates and is a key component of the local flora in these regions.
